listCustomFeats.name: Advanced Manipulation
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You gain one lifeblade feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your lifeblade level is equal to half your character level.

listCustomFeats.name: Ancient Fists
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
By communing with your ancestors and practicing with your fists, you have learned how to harness your own essences to make unarmed attacks far more lethal. The damage die for your fist changes to 1d6 instead of 1d4. You don't take the normal -2 circumstance penalty when making a lethal attack with your fist or any other unarmed attacks. Your unarmed attacks gain the occult trait, making them magical. At 5th level, you also gain the critical specialization effects of unarmed attacks in the brawling group and weapons in the brawling group.

You must equip ancient fist wraps in order to make use of tap self with your fists.

listCustomFeats.name: Athletic Prowess
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Requirements You are in matter trance stance. Your last action was a successful strike against a creature.

You may add your choice of the trip, shove or disarm trait to your weapon if you perform the corresponding Athletics action as your next action. You must still be trained in Athletics to perform actions that require training.

listCustomFeats.name: Attack of Opportunity
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger A creature within your reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

You swat a foe that leaves an opening. Make a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If your attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, you disrupt that action. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

listCustomFeats.name: Basic Manipulation
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level lifeblade feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Blend Essences
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Select two trances you know. When you satisfy the activation requirements of both auras, you activate both auras, regardless of which of the two trances you are in.

For example, if you know both the matter trance and the life trance, you may activate both life trance aura and matter trance aura upon hitting an enemy.

listCustomFeats.name: Bloodied Body
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger You have made two or more successful Strikes this turn. Your last action was a successful Strike.

Consecutive strikes during your turn cause the enemy to hemorrhage. On each successful Strike after the first successful Strike this turn, you inflict 4d6 bleed damage. This damage does not double if the Strike was a critical success.

listCustomFeats.name: Boost Healing
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You gain the boost healing gambit spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Braced and Ready
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Requirements You are standing on the ground. You have at least one hand free.

You become Immobilized. Additionally, nothing may move you from your current position, including from forced movement. You may Ready an action.

listCustomFeats.name: Bramble Armor
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your skin and armor, if you're wearing any, become covered in thorny barbs. Any enemy who successfully Strikes you takes piercing damage equal to half of your level (minimum 1).

listCustomFeats.name: Crippling Precision
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
After successfully striking while effected by trance precision, you may choose to afflict the enemy with one of the following conditions until the start of their turn:
  • Clumsy 1
  • Enfeebled 1

listCustomFeats.name: Crippling Weakness
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You add the following to the list of choices of crippling precision:
  • Physical The target is afflicted with physical weakness 3.
  • Fatigued The target becomes fatigued.
  • Sickened The target becomes sickened.

listCustomFeats.name: Eruption of Life
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Hurt enemies in area. Heal allies in area for that amount. 30ft burst.

Roll 8d12 w/ basic fort save, target up to 5 hostile creatures, roll damage, split damage as you desire. heal allies within the same area for the same amount, splitting as desired.

listCustomFeats.name: Everlasting Essence
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You no longer need to meet the activation requirements for your trance aura. You may use a free action once per turn to toggle the aura matching your trance.

If you have the blend essences lifeblade feat, both auras are always active and you may toggle either aura, but not both, with a free action.

listCustomFeats.name: Expand Influence
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your trance aura grows in size. The radius of all known trance auras are increased by 10 feet.

listCustomFeats.name: Life Trance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You feel a particular connection with the life force of those around you, and use this connection to siphon life energy from foes in order to send it to nearby allies. You enter the life trance stance.

When you successfully Strike a living creature while in this stance, you gain the life trance aura, which grants you and allies within 5 feet life trance healing.

Life Trance Healing You gain fast healing equal to your level.

listCustomFeats.name: Lifeblade Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Dexterity 14

Choose either Life Trance or Matter Trance and gain it as a free feat.
Trained in simple weapons
Trained in martial weapons
Trained in occultism

listCustomFeats.name: Matter Trance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Boost offensive capabilities by linking to the life force of enemies. You enter the matter trance stance.

When you successfully Strike a creature while in this stance, you gain the matter trance aura until the end of your next turn, which grants you and allies within 15 feet matter trance precision.

Matter Trance Precision You deal an additional +1 precision damage on successful Strikes. Double this amount for Critical Success, as normal. At 5th level, increase this bonus to +3 precision damage. At 9th level, increase this bonus to +5 precision damage. At 13th level, increase this bonus to +7 precision damage. At 17th level, increase this bonus to +9 precision damage.

listCustomFeats.name: Mind Trance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You're one step ahead, helping your allies brace for what the enemy may be planning. You enter the Mind Trance stance, enabling you to use any actions with the Trance trait. When you successfully Strike a creature while in this stance, you gain the Mind Trance Aura until the start of your next turn, which grants you and allies within 15 feet Mind Trance Resilience.

Mind Trance Resilience You gain resistances to physical damage equal to half of your level.

listCustomFeats.name: Nimble Dodge
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger A creature targets you with an attack and you can see the attacker.

Requirements You are not encumbered

You deftly dodge out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

listCustomFeats.name: Overflowing Life
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You gain the overflowing life gambit spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Persistent Redirection
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You redirect a persistent damage effect from you or an ally and inflict it upon an enemy instead. Choose yourself or an ally within 15 feet of you suffering from a persistent damage effect and an enemy within 15 feet of you. For the next 1d6 rounds, when the chosen ally would normally take damage from this effect, the chosen enemy takes the damage instead. The chosen ally still rolls checks to recover from the persistent damage effect as normal.

listCustomFeats.name: Pour Life
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You gain the pour life gambit cantrip, which restores health to yourself or an ally.

listCustomFeats.name: Preserve Life
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger An ally within your reach takes damage from an attack.

You react to stop life essence from leaving your ally. Reduce the damage your ally suffers by an amount equal to your level.

listCustomFeats.name: Purge Undeath
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You gain the purge undeath gambit cantrip, which damages an undead creature.

listCustomFeats.name: Quick Draw
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You draw your weapon and attack with the same motion. You Interact to draw a weapon, then Strike with that weapon.

listCustomFeats.name: Reactive Trance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger You or an ally you can sense is about to be hit by an attack or make a saving throw.

You react quickly to help with the burden. You change your stance to another Lifeblade Trance you know. Regardless of whether or not your aura is active at this time, the aura and all effects with the same essence trait end immediately. If your aura was active when this reaction started, you gain the aura matching the new trance you enter.

listCustomFeats.name: Renewed Life
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Funnel your own life into a nearby ally to keep them going. Take persistent damage to keep an ally that died recently alive.

listCustomFeats.name: Sap Heat
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You gain the sap heat gambit spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Shift Pain
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger An ally within 15 feet would receive a type of persistent damage effect.

You receive the persistent damage effect instead of your ally.

listCustomFeats.name: Skirmish Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your feet and weapon move in tandem. Either Step and then Strike, or Strike and then Step.

listCustomFeats.name: Soulsight
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You gain spiritsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 60 feet.

Spiritsense enables you to sense the spirits of creatures, including living creatures, most non-mindless undead, and haunts within the listed range. As with your hearing and other imprecise senses, you still need to Seek to locate an undetected creature.
As spiritsense detects spiritual essence, not physical bodies, it can detect spirits projected by spells such as project image or possessing otherwise soulless objects. It can't detect soulless bodies, constructs, or objects, and like most senses, it doesn't penetrate through solid objects.

listCustomFeats.name: Spirit Trance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Link with enemy creatures' spirits to bolster your allies'. You enter the Spirit Trance stance, enabling you to use any actions with the Trance trait. When you successfully Strike a creature while in this stance, you gain the Spirit Trance Aura until the start of your next turn, which grants you and allies within 15 feet Spirit Trance Resolve.

Spirit Trance Resolve You gain a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws.

listCustomFeats.name: Suffer Life
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You have learned to weaponize life essence. While in life trance, you and all allies within 15 feet deal an additional 5 vitality damage when you successfully Strike. Double this damage on critical success.

At level 16, increase this bonus to 7 vitality damage.

listCustomFeats.name: Swift Essence
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Choose a lifeblade trance you know. You gain a +5 foot status bonus to your Speeds while in that stance. This feat may be taken multiple times, each selecting a different trance. At 7th level, increase this bonus to +10 feet. At 11th level, increase this bonus to +15 feet.

listCustomFeats.name: Tap Self
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You gain the tap self gambit spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Vitality Surge
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You gain the vitality surge gambit spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

listCustomSpells.name: Boost Healing
listCustomSpells.traits: Essence: Life, Focus, Lifeblade, Occult, Manipulate, Vitality, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened: Increase the die size of your pour life healing by 2 steps. If you leave the life trance, the effect is lost.

listCustomSpells.name: Calm Mind
listCustomSpells.traits: Essence: Mind, Focus, Lifeblade, Auditory, Concentrate, Emotion, Linguistic, Mental, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
You recite an ancient poem to calm the minds of those around you. In addition to the normal effects of Spirit Trance Resolve, each affected ally may lower their frightened or stupefied condition by 1 at the start of their turn. If an ally has multiple applicable conditions, they choose which condition to lower.

Heightened (3rd) Add fascinated, sickened and slowed to the list of conditions.

Heightened (5th) Add clumsy, drained and enfeebled to the list of conditions.

listCustomSpells.name: Draw Blood
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
You force your enemy to bleed. Inflict 1d6+1 bleed damage on a creature within your reach.

Heightened (+1) Increase the bleed damage by 1.

listCustomSpells.name: Overflowing Life
listCustomSpells.traits: Concentrate, Essence: Life, Focus, Lifeblade, Occult, Vitality, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Life essence pours from the enemy as freely as a rapid river. Double the amount of healing done by your Life Trance Healing until the start of your next turn.

Heightened (+1) Increase the bleed damage by 1.

listCustomSpells.name: Pour Life
listCustomSpells.traits: Cantrip, Essence: Life, Healing, Lifeblade, Occult, Manipulate, Vitality, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Requirements You made a successful strike against 1 living creature earlier this round. You have not cast pour life this round.
With great concentration, you pull even more life essence from the creature. You redirect this energy to yourself, or 1 willing ally within 30 feet of both the creature and yourself, healing the target for 1d4+1 hit points.
Hightening (+1) Increase the healing done by 1d4+1.
listCustomSpells.range: yourself, or 1 willing ally within 30 feet of both the creature and yourself

listCustomSpells.name: Purge Undeath
listCustomSpells.traits: Cantrip, Essence: Life, Lifeblade, Occult, Vitality, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
You wield the power of life as a weapon and point it toward an undead creature. Deal 1d8 vitality damage to 1 undead creature within 30 feet.

Hightening (+1) Increase the damage done by 1d8.

listCustomSpells.name: Sap Heat
listCustomSpells.traits: Essence: Matter, Focus, Lifeblade, Occult, Manipulate, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Pull heat away from the target creature, causing them to take cold damage. The target creature takes cold damage equal to 1d12 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Heightened (+2) Increase the damage by 1d12.

listCustomSpells.name: Tap Self
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
You tap into your own essence to empower your weapon or unarmed attack. The next Strike made with the chosen weapon or unarmed attack before the start of your next turn gains a +1 status bonus to the attack roll, and the weapon or unarmed strike deals an additional die of damage.

If the chosen weapon leaves your possession, tap self ends immediately.

listCustomSpells.name: Vitality Surge
listCustomSpells.traits: Essence: Life, Focus, Lifeblade, Occult, Manipulate, Vitality, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
The target creature receives temporary hit points equal to the spell level times 2, which last until the end of your next turn.

Heightened (+1) Increase the bleed damage by 1.

listCustomSpecial.name: Lifeblade of Life
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Life Trance feat

listCustomSpecial.name: Lifeblade of Matter
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Matter Trance feat.

listCustomClasses.name: Lifeblade

listCustomSpecials.name: Gambit Spells
listCustomSpecials.description:
In the heat of combat, and while in a trance, you see, hear and feel things that none other can - the very life force of nearby creatures. After striking an opponent, you may perform a gambit, allowing you to manipulate this life force. Gambits are a special type of spell which often require you to successfully strike an enemy before they can be cast. Gambit spells are a type of focus spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell, and you start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You refill your focus pool during your daily preparations, and you can regain 1 Focus Point by spending 10 minutes using the Refocus activity to commune with your ancesters, read ancient texts, or otherwise meditate upon the wisdom of the past.

Your gambit spells are occult spells. You become trained in occult spell attacks and occult spell DCs and your key spellcasting ability is Dexterity.

Focus spells are automatically heightened to half your level rounded up, much like cantrips. Focus spells don't require spell slots, and you can't cast them using spell slots. Taking feats can give you more focus spells and increase the size of your focus pool, though your focus pool can never hold more than 3 Focus Points. The full rules for focus spells are found here.

You learn the tap self gambit spell, allowing you to tap into your own essence to empower your weapon.

listCustomSpecials.name: Expert Lifeblade
listCustomSpecials.description: Your proficiency ranks for Lifeblade Class DC and Occult spellcasting increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Master Lifeblade
listCustomSpecials.description: Your proficiency ranks for Lifeblade Class DC and Occult spellcasting increases to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Legendary Lifeblade
listCustomSpecials.description: Your proficiency ranks for Lifeblade Class DC and Occult spellcasting increases to legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve dedicated yourself to learning the intricacies of your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to expert. You gain access to the critical specialization effects of all weapons for which you have expert proficiency.

listCustomSpecials.name: Evasion
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve learned to move quickly to avoid explosions, dragon’s breath, and worse. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Reflex save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Vigilant Senses
listCustomSpecials.description: Through your adventures, you’ve developed keen awareness and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: You can inflict greater injuries with your favored weapons. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you’re an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you’re a master, and 4 if you’re legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Greater Fortitude
listCustomSpecials.description: Your physique is incredibly hardy, granting you increased endurance. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Improved Evasion
listCustomSpecials.description: Your ability to elude danger is matchless. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to legendary. When you roll a critical failure on a Reflex save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on a Reflex save against a damaging effect, you take half damage.

listCustomSpecials.name: Incredible Senses
listCustomSpecials.description: You notice things almost impossible for an ordinary person to detect. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Light Armor Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve learned how to dodge while wearing light or no armor. Your proficiency rank for light armor and unarmored defense increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: You fully understand your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple, martial weapons and unarmed attacks increase to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: The weapons you’ve mastered become truly fearsome in your hands. Your damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you’re an expert, 6 if you’re a master, and 8 if you’re legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Slippery Mind
listCustomSpecials.description: You play mental games and employ cognitive tricks to throw off mind-altering effects. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success at a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Light Armor Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: Your skill with light armor improves, increasing your ability to dodge blows. Your proficiency ranks for light armor and unarmored defense increase to master.

listCustomClasses.description:
During Combat Encounters…
You enter various stances to heal, protect or bolster your allies. You are nimble and in the front line, eager to disrupt your enemy's plans.

During Social Encounters…
You see things others seem to overlook. Your seemingly endless knowledge intimidates some.

While Exploring…
Knowledable in ancient arts, the information you recall so readily is seen as occult in nature to most. Regardless, your allies are glad to have you on their side, rather than the other way around.

In Downtime…
You study ancient texts, attempt to improve your unique fighting techniques and serve as a guide for tourists, able to cite historical knowledge like you were reading it off of the page.

You Might…
Commune with your ancestors in seclusion, seeking their wisdom and guidance.

Feel a strong sense of duty to your people and loyalty to your friends and companions.

Do things that are difficult or uncomfortable for others to do, such as stand up to a person who appears to be stronger than yourself.

Others Probably…
Are put at ease knowing that you're there to protect them.
